intro: Fimbristylis virella, commonly known as the slender bristle grass, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils, often in wetlands, marshes, or along stream banks. Its slender stems are often adorned with fine, bristly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Fimbristylis virella is generally low-growing, with narrow leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into three-angled berries.
